article.headline: Old Dominion 65, William & Mary 56
article.story: WILLIAMSBURG, Va. (AP) -- Isaiah Hunter scored 22 points and Old Dominion tightened its defense after a slow start and beat William & Mary 65-56 on Saturday night. The Monarchs (14-5, 7-2 Colonial Athletic Association) held the Tribe to under 31 percent shooting in the second half after trailing 30-25 at halftime. Hunter had 12 points in the second half and Alex Loughton, who scored 12, had 10. Laimis Kisielius scored 16 and Nathan Mann 14 for William & Mary (5-12, 0-8), which was outrebounded 41-28 and outscored 22-11 at the foul line on its home floor. The Monarchs trailed 32-25 after Adam Payton's jumper to start the second half, then scored seven straight points to tie it. The game was tied four more times, but Abdi Lidonde hit a pair of free throws with 6:55 to play and ODU never trailed again. The Tribe pulled within two twice, but Hunter fed Brian Henderson and then Drew Williamson for 3-pointers each time and Old Dominion finally pulled comfortably ahead. Hunter added six assists, and Loughton led the Monarchs with nine rebounds.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
